adjectives.description: contumacious (comparative more contumacious, superlative most contumacious)

entries.meaning: Contemptuous of authority; willfully disobedient; rebellious.
examples: […]  and, on his conſtancie, ſounds an accuſation to Herod of a contumacious affront, on ſuch a day, before many peers; præpares the king to ſome paſſion, and at laſt, by her daughter’s dancing, effects it.

entries.meaning: (law) Willfully disobedient to the summons or orders of a court.
